titlestmt.titleproper: Buffalo Federation of Women’s Clubs Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid created by Buffalo History Museum staff.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by Grace Trimper, October 2018.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using local best practices.

did.unittitle: Buffalo Federation of Women’s Clubs Records

physdesc.extent: 18 boxes, 4 slim boxes, 2 volumes (10.25 linear ft.)

acqinfo.p: Donated by Elizabeth Shenton, Jean McFarrent, John L. Cobb, Wanda Horbett, Helen Yaeger & Gloria McDonald. 74-113, 79-6.

prefercite.p: Buffalo History Museum Research Library, Mss. C92-2, Buffalo Federation of Women’s Clubs Records

processinfo.p: Reprocessed/retroconverted by Peter Nelson and Mary F. Bell.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers wishing to access this collection must apply for a Scholar Pass and present valid photo ID upon arrival to the library.

bioghist.p: An alliance of women's clubs founded in 1905 as the Buffalo City Federation of Women's Clubs; name changed in 1939. Originally comprising 28 member clubs involved in civic activities "to further citizenship, education and philanthropy," the B.F.W.C. comprised some 71 member clubs by 1985.

scopecontent.p: Includes minutes, 1930-1996; committee reports, 1936-1996; convention files, 1907-1996; Federation Days files, 1938-1996; bulletins, 1944-1996; rosters, 1926/27-1993/94; photographs, undated and 1965-1992; scrapbooks, 1958-1980; and clippings, undated and 1924-1990. Also included in series I are materials of the Bicentennial Committee (1976), including a tape cassette of a program, correspondence with Congressman Jack Kemp, and a greeting from President Gerald R. Ford.

userestrict.p: Written permission required to reproduce and/or publish. Information on use and fees may be obtained from the Director of Library and Archives.
